intro: Chiococca paniculata, commonly known as the yellow bell tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in pendulous clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. The tree can grow up to 10 meters tall and is often found in humid, shaded environments in the understory of tropical forests.
